text:
Draft at Als / Pizza Boy in Enola.
Head is initially small, frothy, off-white, mostly lasting.
Body is medium to dark amber.
Aroma is lightly malty (caramel, toasted grain), moderately hoppy (apricot, orange, grapefruit, resin).
Flavor is moderately to heavily sweet, lightly acidic, lightly bitter.
Finish is lightly to moderately sweet, lightly acidic, moderately bitter.
Medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation, lightly alcoholic.
I have to give credit to PB for getting good hop expression...most Simcoe beers reek of onion, but this is a fruit bomb, as are most of their hoppy brews. Nice beer if a tad sweet.

Sampled from a 22 oz brown bottle this beer poured a hazy caramel-brown color with an enormous foamy orange-tan head that lingered forever and left good lacing. The aroma was malty, sour caramel, crystal malt and pineapple. The flavor was tart and bitter with sour caramel, crystal malt and pineapple. Long finish. Medium body. Ok.

2/20/15. Sampled during RBWG 2015. Amber pour with a small khaki head. Light pineapple aroma, dank, light spice and black tea. Moderately bitter taste, some tropical fruits, caramel, light spice and tea. Not bad.

Bottle shared during RBWG on the Booze Bus. Thanks to whoever shared this! Amber pour with a medium white head. Citrus and pinecone on the nose. Spiced wood and earthy toasted grain. Grainy sweetness. Brown toast. A bit of crisp lemon and honeydew melon. Toasty finish. Dry and easy to drink. Nice.
Pours dark copper with white head. Smell is malt, hops and resin. Taste is crisp with malt then a dank earthy hop flavor hits. Medium body high carb.

Bottle at the Breen Hampton house. Pours murky copper with milky off white head that persists. Piney and earth hops, rye spicy grain malts on the nose. Lots of the same flavor profile with medium bodied and little bit of soapy malt characteristics but still quite good. A lil chewy.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle... RBWG 2015 Hazy dirty-orange pour with a small, creamy, white head thats gone in the blink of an eye. The aroma features tea biscuit, toffee, fresh leather, caramel and pissy, musky hops. Full-bodied with a lightly creamy mouthfeel and adequate carbonation. The flavor is bittersweet, featuring tea biscuit, toffee and pithy, crusty bitterness. Well-balanced, crisp, refreshing finish.

Bottle during RBWG Booze Buse 20/02/15 thanks to whomever for this juan.
Hazed golden amber with a decent off white covering.
Nose is caramel malt, spice, rye bread, pine.
Taste comprises light pine, bitter orange, tropical fruit notes, bread dough, light spice.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close with an earthy hop rinse.
Decent.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Bottle thanks to Brian! Pours a near clear orange amber with a tan head that lasts throughout the beer and laces. Aroma has a combination of pine and rye with a touch of earthiness underlying. Flavor has a good amount of pine with some earthy grass and a rye bite in the finish.

Bottle share on the bus during RBWG 2015. Pours rich gold with a tan foam head. Grainy and spicy, with some piney bitterness, rye, moderate bitterness. Medium bodied with average carbonation. Finishes fairly sweet with more spicy rye, grains, pine. Good one.

Ticked on the bus during the rbwg2015 brewery bus tour. 22oz bomber pours with murky brown body that supports a tan head. The aroma offers up lightly roasted malts, chocolate malts maybe and then a dash of citrus. The taste starts with a mix of roasted malts and a modest malt sweetened resiny hoppiness. It then pulls up pleasing citrus and a bit of tropical juicy fruitiness. I like the play between malts and bitter hops and juiciness.

Bottle on the Brew Bus during the RBWG 2015 bus tour. Hazy golden orange with off-white head. Aromas of floral, citrus. Tastes of floral, citrus, light tropical fruit, caramel. Medium body with a dry finish.

Bottle on the RBWG brew bus 
Cloudy golden with a small white head, some lacing. Aroma of sweet toffee and citrus. Flavors of malts, citrus and spices 
Decent
Bottle, RBWG 2015 bus beer. Nice combo of spice, pine, bitterness. Tasty stuff.
Bottle during RBWG bus tour, pours a cloudy orange copper with small white head. The aroma is strong pine and rye. Similar flavor to nose, resin finish, nice.

Bottle on the bus. A strong grassy and pepper aroma with a moderate toffee and butter sweetness. Some alcohol warming. Good seem to get butter but without much flavor as it warms. Toffee aspirin water.

(22oz bomber) thick creamy orangish head, great lacing, cloud orange body. Nose of rye, celery, alcohol, citrus peel. Taste of rye, alcohol, mildly spicy and really nicely balanced but fairly malty at the same time. Thick body, great linger.

Bottle. Bright red. Rye spice with fruity notes. Extremely clean feel with some resins. Good stuff. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Red with a big fluffy white head. Aroma is peach, pear, floral and a little pine. Taste follows pretty closely and adds some rye spice. Medium creamy mouthfeel and somewhat strong carb. Really good.
Bottle. Thanks bmart. Hazy orange with thick head that sticks around for a while. Nose is hop bitter with floral and fruity notes. Taste is bitter hops, a bit sweet malt. Dry mouthfeel. Really nice.

Bottle at Franks. Pours a clear golden orange body with thin white lacing. Aroma is sweet fruity hop, light sugar and clean malt. Mouthfeel is soft and light with notes of fruity hop, clean pale malt, light bread, light grass and sweet fruit. This seemed to be a bit dull, maybe require a revisit.

Sample at the Badge-Whore Bowl (OSU vs AL) tasting on 01/01/2015. The beer pours a clear amber color with a medium off-white head that dissipates steadily. Strings of lacing on the glass. Aroma of citrus, hops and rye malt. Medium-bodied with flavors of citrusy hops, spicy rye, and grainy malt. The finish is moderately bitter with a fruity hops aftertaste. Pretty good overall.
Bottle. Color is murky orange with perfect creamy head. Nice spicy grass aroma. Taste is very nice fruity citrus hop.
At Matts to kick off the new year. Pours bronze orange with which layer of head. Aroma is nice fresh simcoe hops, orange fruit. Taste is light fluffy simcoe Orange nice fruity juicy hops.

Bomber into price pint glass. Deep red with pillowy root beer float head. 6 inches on first vigorous pour dwindling to one fluffy white inch. Luscious fruity aroma, woody malty grain. Flavor muted, sweet and bitter. Could be that I waited a bit too long to drink. Creamy mouthfeel is to this beers credit.
22oz bottle. Poured an amberish color with an off white head. Fruity, citrus, caramel, some rye, and toastiness.

Copper-amber body with a medium sized off-white head and soapy lacing. Grapefruit, pine, rye, resin, and florals. Mild biscuity malt base. Medium bodied with lively carbonation and assertive bitterness. Semi-dry throughout. Nice.

Pours a reddish amber with a large foamy off white lacing head. Aroma of orange hard candies, tropical fruits, other citrusy hop notes and a touch of caramel and rye. Flavor of the same orange candy and citrusy hop notes along with an earthy profile. Lightly toasted malt, some caramel and light rye.

Bottle from Bistro on Bridge. Pours Amber to brown with nice head that lingers perfectly. Nose is sweet tropical fruits, mild pine sap and earthy qualities. First sip is similar with pale malt and caramel. Finish is dry with nice citrus notes.

Bottle from Whole Foods Plymouth. Hazy copper pour with off-white head. Nose was caramel malt, intense Sin=mcoe hops, rye, juicy tropical fruit. Tastes intensely hoppy, with notes of honeydew, tangerine, pineapple, and a crisp, well balanced finish. This is the best PB beer ever, and an incredible beer that you MUST experience.
UPDATED: APR 5, 2015 Hops are great. Deep red color. Flavor is rich and lasts well after first sip. Lingers on tongue. Husband loves it. Tap
Rye kick in the finish. bottle from Capones. Not so simcoe or hoppy, decent drinkability.Unique.

Bottle @ ZZT X, small sample, thanks all for sharing! Slight hazy amber color, short head. Aroma of lots pine, pine woods, autumn, slight grapefruit, bit grainy rye. Medium to high bitterness in taste. Lovely stuff.
Bottle @ ZZTX. Amber color. Peach, ginger and marmelade in the aroma. Perfumed. Floral. Malty sweet flavor with floral, perfumed notes. Alcoholic, rye whisky. Nice.
Bottle in trade. Pours a copper, deep color, white head. Aroma is mix of malt and hops. Taste is same, mix of hops and malt, caramel. Lighter than I expected. Tasty beer.
Bottle @ ZZTX. Aroma is huge Simcoe, light malt. Like fresh out of the vacuum bag. Flavour is huge bitter hoppy madness. Great!

Bottle @ ZZT X, courtesey of kermis. Pours a clear amber beer with a big off white head on top. Aroma is pine-needles, grapefruit, very fresh citric and loads of other fresh hoppy stuff going on. Flavor is very bitter, loads of citrus and grassy hops going on and has long bitter aftertaste. This is some great stuff!

Bottle @ ZZT X shared by kermis. Lightly hazy reddish color, small off-white head. Aroma is incredibly hoppy and fruity. Taste is light to moderately malty, very hoppy, a lot of grassy hops, lightly fruity, pretty nicely bitter. Medium body and carbonation. Nice one!

Bottle shared at ZZT 10. Pours hazy amber brown with a medium tan head. Aroma of orange, citrus, juicy tangerine, light grapefruit, pineapple and rye. Flavor is light moderate sweet and over moderate bitter. Medium bodied with light carbonation.
Bottle @zzt10 shared by kermis. Orange brown color with a small head. Smells hoppy, citra, fruity, nice. Tastes hoppy, bitter and some fruit.
Bottle @ ZZT 10 shared by Kermis. Hazy amber to copper colour with a small off-white head. Smells hops, fresh, fruity. Tastes fruity, fresh, nice, hops, great. Medium body, nice active carbo.

Pours a hazy reddish amber...mild sediment...medium white head...nice lacing and retention. Aroma has some really orangey citrus...some tangerine and rindiness...very mild maltiness. Flavor follows suit...very fruity but adds some mild earthy rye...earthy bitterness and sweet/tangy citrus. Mouthfeel is medium and silky with a dry earthy/rye finish.

Pours reddish amber thick with a beige head. Aroma brings pungent skunky body odor so delicious in the nose, and citrus sweetness in the backend. The flavor is tame on the spice for the rye bringing lemony hops smooth on the tongue with a juicy body. It is delicious and the Simcoe hops are showcased so well.

Very pretty red Amber with a lacing head. The aroma has that Simcoe pine to it. The flavor has a very nice malt base with the hops coming on. Dry and tasty with a rye smoothness. Best IPA I've had in a while. At Pinocchio's. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle at weekly tasting. Pours reddish amber white head. Nose/taste of rye, caramel malt, resin, pine and toast. Medium body.
Bottle. Brown pour with tan head. Nice herbal and grassy hop flavors and flavors. Nice fresh hop tones.
Comes off as a hoppy red ale with slight rye spice. The hops are lovely and the driving force of this beer. Good stuff.

Aroma: Citrus, Rye, Mild Currants

Appearance: Dark Reddish/Brown Hue, Passes Some Light, Mildly Off White Head, Decent Lacing

Taste:Rye, Mild Grapefruit Rind, Mild Orange

Mouthfeel: Decent Carbonation, Medium Bodied, Mildly Grainy, Mildly Bitter

UPDATED: JUN 26, 2013 Served on-tap at Als of Hampden.

A - Pours clear amber orange with a nice one and a half finger tall white head leaving small trails of lace down parts of the glass.

S - Smells of citric and grassy simcoe hops with some spicy rye helping to keep them in check. Some caramel and light fruitiness offers some additional flavors but this one is all about the simcoe and rye.

T - Starts off with a quick hit of spicy /  chewy rye quickly being enveloped by the strong citric hop bite from the simcoe hops. Hints of fresh cut grass, caramel sweetness and dulled tropical fruit help round things out. Finish is chewy with plenty of lingering hop bitterness.

M - Medium body with moderate carbonation. Bitter, chewy feel from start to finish. Some light sweetness and booze creep in toward the end of the glass.

O - Even with all of the assertive flavors this one remains easy to drink. If you have a chance to try this one I suggest you do, it is one of Pizza Boys better beers to date.
